p: An ANCOVA using geographic range size (log 10 transformed) and taxonomic group as predictors revealed that both had a significant association with the vulnerability index (F 5,204 = 36.05, p< 0.001). Geographic range size was negatively related to climate change vulnerability, with the most narrowly distributed species showing high to extreme vulnerability (F 1,204 = 133.64, p< 0.001; Fig 1).
